Reviews.Title: “aspleys restaurant amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: phoebewillett
Reviews.Content: I tried to write a review for the restaurant seperately but it wouldnt allow me, anyway we went to aspleys restaurant at the lanesborough for valentines day it was a set dinner 7 courses for £230 per person, which included rose champagne on arrival and different wine with each course, the service was another level and the food has to be the best ive ever had, I was rather tipsy after drinking the 7 glasses of wine that came with each dish but it was truelly an amazing experience one I would highly recommend, the room was stunning very elegant it was just a fabulous evening all round. I have previously staid at the lanesborough hotel and also highly recommend the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best ever”
Reviews.Author: londontravellista
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at Hyde Park corner, across the street from the tube station and with the Hyde Park right in front of the hotel. You can walk anywhere from here, night and day, as is as central as can get. The hotel has a great restaurant on the ground floor, large, quiet, exquisite and very expensive, hence is never full and the piano bar on the ground floor or 'The Library' is really old school. You might get the odd 20 years old blonde with her group of shouting friends to show off a bit but eventually they go away to leave place for an older and calmer crowd. The suite I was given was one of the most expensive and felt like home: great linen, good bed and really great mix of good furniture and surroundings. The bedroom was accessible via a sitting room from the hallway and although not being huge, everything was carefully thought and distributed around. One of the top hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A London Classic”
Reviews.Author: Soxgirl0407
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 2/9-2/12/12. The hotel is an old London hotel. It has a lovely restaurant, in which we only ate breakfast. There is a great library bar, with a piano, which was always pretty crowded, no matter if it was the afternoon or 1 in the morning. We stayed in one of the few rooms that had two beds, which were both twins. The rooms were clean and the bathroom had both a shower and a big tub to soak in. The room was extremely quiet. The service was okay. We had a butler assigned to the room, who showed up within minutes of checking in. I gave her some articles to be pressed and never saw her again. I had to call the concierge the next day to find out where my clothes were as they were never returned. We also had trouble with our room keys, as they wouldn't open the door to our room. They were finally replaced. Small aggravations, nothing major. The hotel was very expensive as were the restaurant and bar but that's London. The location was great, as the Tube stop was almost directly in front of the hotel entrance. There is a little bakery down the street, and a great pub around the corner. Overall, a good experience at a London classic.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: flo-josh
Reviews.Content: Went for afternoon tea as a half-term treat. Throughout the visit the service was courteous, friendly and attentive. Happily it was not over-attentive or patronising. Slight hiccup as they had forgotten that I had said we are vegetarian when booking and so brought out chicken and salmon sandwiches. However, as should be the case, they were embarrassed rather than making us feel so. The replacements were delicious, so Veggies, you can go for afternoon tea and get something to suit you; as well as the usual cucumber or egg sandwiches, there was mozzarella and tomato, avocado and beetroot, pepper wraps etc. My favourites were the scones and the caramelized onion and blue cheese tartlets. Despite not really having eaten anything that day, I ran out of steam before all the cakes, though my husband manfully continued. The ambience was delightful - pianist, warm, friendly, buzz of conversation. (Maybe something other than songs from the shows, though I guess that suits a lot of tourists - light jazz or classical?). Overall, a real treat and one definitely to be repeated. We're planning who to take with us next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: PetterHB
Reviews.Content: Perfect weekend stay at The Lanesborough. Very friendly staff. The afternoon tea had an great atmosphere and the piano bar was a great hang out for an after dinner whiskey at a slow fridays night. The room was clean, spacious and had a personal butler. Delivered my suit and shirts for pressing at 4pm and had it delivered at my door at 7pm. All over a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality......”
Reviews.Author: Kevin1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lanesborough in December as a a treat to celebrate my wife's Birthday. Having stayed in a few 5 Star hotels in London over the past year or so we both agreed that this is by far the best, and the one that we would choose to return to. Everything about this hotel is just right - the location, the ambience, the rooms, the service, but above all the understated elegance which makes it so special. There is no air of pomposity here, but a warm and friendly atmosphere that we really appreciated. The Rooms are not huge but perfectly adequate in size, and sumptuously equipped. Very much an Old English style of room, but with Hi-Tech additions that are cleverly hidden in the background. Beds and linen were as you would expect them to be - highest quality. If we had one gripe it would be the speed of the hotel internet. It was painfully slow, but this may be more to the nature of the building itself, which looks like it was is hewn out of solid rock many years ago. There is a butler in attendance at all times, but this service is unobtrusive and only visible when you need it. They also do a very fine job of pressing clothes if this is needed. The Bathroom was rather like something from the Orient Express with lashings of wood panelling. The products provided are excellent, and you can purchase these from Reception. Although "old fashioned" in appearance, everything works perfectly. We had a very good Breakfast in the delightful dining room, and were welcomed and looked after by all the staff we met. All other public areas have a grand feel about them, and in particular the Cigar Room was just wonderful - there is nowhere else like this in London. Well worth a look at this, even if you do not smoke, but I would not recommend it to people who have recently stopped smoking! So not the cheapest hotel you will stay in, but one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: happywalkerYorkshire
Reviews.Content: as a Christmas present a group of us gave each other afternoon tea and chose The Lanesborough. I can't say how it compares to other places as afternoon tea is not my usual thing but as a treat this would take some beating. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff are attentive without being too much. There was a great selection and we all came away having had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “London should be very proud of this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lily23Winchester
Reviews.Content: Vogue once said : As the chill wind blows across Hyde Park, it is comforting to know that you can close the drapes and luxuriate at The Lanesborough. I sit, in my room at the Lanesborough, writing this review, over looking Hyde Park. The hotel started modern life as St Georges Hospital, having once been a private house. In 1991 it was reborn as a hotel. I was born here and wanted to celebrate my birthday in the hotel. The staff could not have been more thrilled to help me make this day special. Champagne, birthday cake and wonderful breakfasts, personalised writing paper in our room - nothing too much trouble for any of the staff here. The rooms are ornate, the food and cocktails memorable (for the right reasons), and the service is second to none. If you get the opportunity to sample The Lanesborough, whether it's for drinks, or afternoon tea, or as a resident - grab it with both hands and don't let go !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: Comolover
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful afternoon tea to celebrate my wife's birthday. Totally recomended

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best Aftenoon Tea in London”
Reviews.Author: terryrothery
Reviews.Content: My wife and I plus our daughter and friend took afternoon tea, with champagne, at Ashley's here at The Lanesborogh. The staff were very friendly and so helpful too. This is our third visit as we love having our tea here as a special treat in December each year! The food, including delicious sandwiches and cakes is creative and blends perfectly with the glass of champagne. The fresh strawberrys were amazing and the scones with clotted cream just "yummy"!!! Something new this year, well I don't remember being served it last year, is mulled wine which just about finished us all off!!! All in all, a fantastic experience once again and one that I would recommend you try for yourselves. A big thank you to the staff who served us and a special thank you to the hotel manager, a Mr Michael Naylor-Leyland who greeted us so nicely and always seems to be around when we visit and is professional and attentive. He has a great team!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best 5 star hotels on the planet”
Reviews.Author: Gudleiv
Reviews.Content: A hotel in a unique building with a position right next to Hyde Park, some of the best restaurants on the planet with 95 rooms, giving it a boutique feeling. The service is as good as it gets, the food is worthy of two stars in the Michelin guide and the bartenders makes drinks the old fashioned way... The ambience is truly fantastic thought the hotel. The rooms are all different, but they are unlike anything in a modern building; they have lots of charm! You will not be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “World Wide, my favorite place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DaveKapolei_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: When I think about it, there is nothing about this hotel I would change. It is just the right size (about 95 rooms). Smaller and it would not have some of the fantastic amenities and public spaces (like its bar) that it has. Bigger and it would lose that sense of being in a British Lordâ€™s house. Which at one point it was and at another a hospital. The location is the best. Hyde Park Corner. Easy to walk or tube to anywhere. I mentioned the bar. Fantastic place to just be for a light lunch or cocktails. The rooms look like they were from the 18th century but all the most modern of conveniences discreetly hid. And the best part is the staff. In that low key way which is so typical of high class Brittan, they take care of every need and with the discretion and style of those who tend the property across the street (Buckingham Palace). There is no doubt you are treated like reality here. If you are traveling with a bunch of kids and are on a budget, this may not be your cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing everything...but Â£34 for a croissant and coffee?!”
Reviews.Author: auntietrace
Reviews.Content: I've had the opportunity and pleasure to stay in a lot of fine hotels and resorts over the years- and The Lanesborough was for sure one experience I'll not forget anytime soon- but really, do you need all the pomp to feel looked after? I stayed here with a friend visiting for one night in London...and for one night's stay the room bill was Â£Â£Â£+ and it wasn't anything extraordinary- (although the view was overlooking Wellington Arch). The staff were bend-over-backwards accommodating (until we requested the Rolls take us to town at 11pm...no driver on duty)...the Cigar Bar was fantastic and the staff there really knew their stuff. We spent a great percentage of our evening in The Library drinking extremely well-mixed martinis and cocktails, nibbling on olives and nuts, chatting to the waiters and generally watching the world go by. We had a fantastic recommendation for dinner at a local steakhouse (see other review) and another recommendation for bars, clubs and general nightlife venues. While the room we had was clean, comfortable and what you would expect from a St Regis, it was small, slightly dated and worn- and I don't mean in a 'quaint' way. I can think of other places to spend that sort of money on that are a step up- but perhaps without the title, pomp and assumed grandeur. The three meals we ate in the hotel were well worth the lunch menu prices but our breakfast bill was Â£34 for a coffee (filtered) and two croissants- both which would have been nicer down the road at Paul. Everything here is premium- even airport transfers at +Â£80 the regular rate. Yes, it's a St Regis...but the one in Houston was better albeit without all the London hype.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel for Afternoon Tea!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah P
Reviews.Content: I had been to the Lanesborough before for afternoon tea and loved it so much we went back again for my dad's birthday. I mentioned at the time of booking that it was his birthday and also that my mum was gluten and dairy free which they said was fine and that they provide different options for people with different eating requirements. I thought this was very good as not many afternoon tea places offer this. The hotel was as beautiful as always and as I had requested we were sat right next to the pianist who asked us if we had any special requests for him to play which was a lovely touch. The service is usually very slick and professional, however, on this occasion, they forgot to order the gluten and dairy free afternoon tea which takes 40 minutes to make (even though we did give the required 12 hours notice and it was on their system). They really did make up for it though as they gave us an extra glass of champagne each and an extra fruit platter so it didn't spoil things at all. They also brought out a special cake on a plate that had happy birthday written on it in chocolate which was also very thoughtful. Our waiter was very knowledgable and polite, he explained what each course was and when we requested extra sandwiches, it was not a problem at all. I would definitely go back again becuase even though they made a mistake, they made up for it really well. One more thing to add, they welcomed well behaved children and one baby sat next to the pianist and he played the snowman and also twinkle twinkle little star whcih made it really special for that family.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Eleni K
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel at the best location!The service exceptional, the rooms (suite) fantastic, the restaurant the best experience and the cigar bar beautiful!!!! I highly recommend The Lanesborough! My favourite hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Biggest event of my life so far - best hotel on the planet.”
Reviews.Author: DurhamStudent
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, everything about our stay at the Lanesborough surpassed all my expectations. The reception staff were very welcoming, and every member of staff we came across knew exactly all the details of my engagement plans. We were made to feel so special with the upgrade and champagne, and on top of that breakfast was phenomenal. Hopefully we'll be able to keep coming back time after time!

Reviews.Title: “Very 'tired' hotel now.....”
Reviews.Author: RallyDriver2
Reviews.Content: I was booked in here for 4 nights by Amex Centurion service. I left at 0730 after 1 night. Why? I have stayed here before (8+years ago) and now the rooms/hotel are plain worn-out and outdated. Worse, they are seemingly very cramped. My Junior Suite (rack rate Â£1,100 approx) had only a single basin (and a small one at that) with no shelving; I've seen larger bathrooms in airport Holiday Inns. The lighting arrangements are uber complex. Touch screen pads instead of switches, bulbs blown (housekeeping where are you?!) just a irritating puzzle game to find an ambient light. Worst of all was the smoke. Floor 3 was (I was told a non-smoking floor) yet guests were allowed to smoke in certain rooms/suites. Cigar smoke pervaded the corridors and my room. I am NOT a anti-smoking fascist, I just don't want to wake up to stale cigar smoke that had wafted into my room. The St Regis 'Butler Service' is outdated and very poorly executed too, however 'well-meaning'. The whole hotel had an air of being run down, tatty at the edges. That said, the location is good-ish and breakfast was, well, just breakfast. I can't comment on their bar or dining 'experience' and my 30 min massage was capable, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Tea...for that special occasion..”
Reviews.Author: LondonFet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were taken to tea there as a wedding present and it was absolutely fabulous. Ok it's not cheap but for a treat it's just superb. Beautiful setting, lovely food, very, dainty but you can order as much as you like, and of course delicious tea,,try out the library bar beforehand do a great Bloody Mary(I tried the yellow one..) Looking for that special treat? Well this could well be the place..

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Nick S
Reviews.Content: The Cellar dining room was the surprise venue for my stepson's recent 40th celebratory luncheon and everything about The Lanesborough and The Cellar was first class. Champagne at midday was followed by a delicious three course luncheon with complementary wines. The staff were helpful and efficient and the surroundings were truly sumptuous (as Dick van Dyke might try to say...). Definitely a place to return to for that special person and occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry London hotels, I'll never stay anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: Embratora
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel! From the premises (understated class, friendly, private, warm, spacious) to the staff (polite, discreet, friendly, prompt), to the food (delicious, especially the club sandwich and the Caesar salad!) -- all straight As!! The rooms are lovely and luxurious without being hip and pretentious -- the bathrooms products are unbelievable (and for sale) too. Each room comes with a laptop and free wifi - a major win whether youre a business person or just a traveler. The concierge can get you into pretty much any restaurant or show without batting an eyelid. Not in the mood to go out? Try the cigar bar downstairs - a real scene! It's outdoors so you dont smell the smoke, and they have heating in the winter. Hands down my fave London hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea - without the tea”
Reviews.Author: takemeroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: The whole point of paying out this much for scones, cakes and tea which you could get at your local supermarket is.....SERVICE!! Sadly whilst there were plenty of waiting staff available during tea, there was no-one ready to check and refill our teas! I guess there isn't much of an incentive when service charge is mandatory. My tea issue would not have been such a problem if the hotel had not helpfully placed all our unmarked teapots on a separate side table to make space. I guess eventually I would have worked it out myself which was mine, and could have gotten up to locate my tea but like I say, you would have expected at this end of the market, more attentive staff.....after all detail matters and I don't want to have to stare mournfully at my empty teacup for ten minutes before the message gets across that I have no tea. Try Browns, Berkely and Fortnums.....much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Our perfect wedding”
Reviews.Author: Helen J
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing place in London that you can get married. Â We had 4 short months to plan the day and this would not have been possible without our wedding planner at the hotel who was just incredible. Â She is such an asset to their team. She gave us so many great ideas and really understood what it was we wanted from the day.Â  They organised a harpist for us which was amazing. She played as the guests arrived, as we walked up and down the aisle and also for the champagne reception. Â We also had a photo booth and a prop box which was so much fun.. The photos are hysterical and everyone enjoyed it. The wedding day was just the best day ever, everything went according to plan. Â We had 120 guests and the food was incredible and the service impeccable. All the staff were so professional it truly is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Â I know I might be slightly biased but honestly, we have had such lovely feedback from the guests too. It is on the expensive side, but it is definitely worth every penny. Â We are going to go back for our first anniversary and I can't wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, intimate, perfect”
Reviews.Author: ODonnell-Stephen
Reviews.Content: We spent our tenth anniversary here at the Lanesborough. A wonderful experience and one we will be repeating. The service is just completely over the top and we loved every bit of it. We were pampered mercilessly and had a wonderful time. Thank you to the entire Lanesborough team.

Reviews.Title: “It smells like in a kitchen”
Reviews.Author: AlexGZurich
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Lanesborough, my room smelled worse than every kitchen, the aircondition blew the entire kitchen air into my room, the smell was terrible! I have never experienced anything similar. I immediately checked out and guess what? They charged the entire amount!!!!! This is the worst hotel experience I have ever experienced. The person at the reception offered me another room, but unfortunately it smelled the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Horace4590
Reviews.Content: When you are invited to breakfast with your hosts for 10.30 a.m., you're in reasonable need of something to eat. The Lanesborough breakfast staff don't see things this way. Orange juice comes quickly. Hot beverages take 10 minutes, with tea served in a mad, silver teapot. where the tea leaves are held in a container at the top, so that the hot water passes straight through without steeping, and the resultant brew is like weak dishwater. Ordering from the menu requires several signals to the serving staff, by which time 20 minutes have passed. Another half hour elapses before 3 out of 4 expensive, portion-controlled selections arrive. During this period, no breakfast breads or toast are served, despite a request to the senior steward. It's 50 minutes of enforced starvation, grumbling stomachs and tablecloth gazing, and another 25 minutes before the final incorrect dish emerges. From start to finish, breakfast takes 90 minutes. It's 12 noon. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel, period”
Reviews.Author: Myron K
Reviews.Content: The true definition of luxury. The most attentive staff without being over the top. The Lanesborough should be the standard that all other hotels follow.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful way to start married life!”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: My (now) Wife and I stayed here for our wedding night and the night after in mid September. From the moment we arrived outside and the doorman came to greet us we knew we were in for a special treat. Our luggage had been delivered some nine hours before we arrived and been efficiently dealt with by the concierge. Our subsequent welcome was friendly & courteous - there were smiles & congratulations aplenty but without being ingratiating or overbearing. The service throughout our stay was impeccable and the hotel itself exceeded all expectations. We were upgraded to a suite on arrival, which was hugely appreciated by myself and bride as you can imagine! The suite was fantastic - all the quality and features you would expect from a top level 5* hotel with a seamless integration of old elegance and modern style & facilities. The Hotel was a delight to explore with the 'withdrawing room', Library bar and Garden room offering different takes on how to relax in style & luxury. Breakfast at Apsleys was a perfect way to start the day with good food, good choice and attentive service. The fresh flower displays in the lobby and throughout were magnificent and have to be seen to be believed. We left wishing we had opted to spend our whole honeymoon here and with nothing but fond memories and a desire to return. Anniversary?! I know my spectacles could be considered 'rose tinted' as I had just had a wonderful wedding ceremony to the woman I love, but such a high is a fragile and precarious thing which can be brought crashing down very easily by the slightest of faults. We encountered none. Thank you Lanesborough, see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Home...”
Reviews.Author: SCenturion
Reviews.Content: Felt entirely at home. Old school done right. Amazing staff including the butler, Katja. I fell ill after a meal at C! Extended my stay, and recovered with the comforts of home. Looking back, I would've been miserable at any other hotel. Fresh fruit replenished, and special request meals all done to ensure my recovery. In spite of facing Hyde Park Corner, the double glazing did just enough to keep the double deckers at bay. The only odd experience was the concierge. He was not rude, just odd. The Berkeley, while perhaps more contemporary, is stiff competition just down the road. But this is British at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 112 for one-week honeymoon in May 2009. This hotel is ideal for both business and pleasure. Not uploading additional pictures as the pictures already posted give a fair picture of the hotel. Pros: Complimentary butler delivery of tea to room each morning. Full-length New York Times (not just the Times Digest usually on offer in hotels abroad). Wide variety of vegetarian options in restaurant including at breakfast. Incomparable traditional decor. Lovely library bar and restaurant. Attentive and prompt concierge service and staff. Breakfast, for which the otherwise high cost was included in our room rate, was delicious and so voluminous as to supersede lunch. Delicious and copious selection of tea. Complementary use of laptop computer and good working desk area. Sophisticated but intuitive control panel for everything in the room. Cleverly designed bed-mounted reading lights enable one person to read while the other enjoys total darkness. Butler available to unpack and pack your luggage. Complementary pressing of one garment per person upon arrival. Ideal location, atop the Hyde Park Corner tube station at the convergence of Hyde Park, Green Park, Piccadilly, and Apsley House. It is an easy and pleasant walk to those and other major attractions such as Buckingham Palace, Kensington Palace and Gardens, St. James' Park, St. James' Palace, the Mall, Horse Guards' Parade, War Cabinet Rooms and Churchill Museum, and more. Cons: Water leaked copiously from shower onto bathroom floor. Room 112 apparently sits directly across from a service doorway which we could hear constantly opening and closing along with staff talking. Was erroneously charged for a clothes pressing which should have been included with the room charge. This was however promptly corrected. No pool but go during warm weather and swim in the Lido in the Serpentine, practically across the street. Small television considering the price of the room. Unknowns: Did not have a chance to visit the gym and spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless elegance”
Reviews.Author: unicorngirl
Reviews.Content: Although old fashioned, I think this is half the charm of the Lanesborough. It's the little touches that make this hotel special. Personalised stationary,a laptop to use, a butler service and night turn downs are a sweet touch. I came here expecting frosty staff, but never encountered this.. Staff in five stars are usually cold towards me, as I am in my early 20's and a bit of a 'wacky' dresser. But the staff here were extremely friendly. Our room was on the small side, but as a couple we didn't mind this. Room service was speedy and the food was delicious and not overpriced. Although the hotel is in a great central London location, the room was quiet and we never heard traffic. As a smoker I was delighted to have a smoking room, which never smelt smoky. The room was cleaned daily to a high standard and the butler did a wonderful job. If you want traditional understated elegance, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “perfect service and very nice room”
Reviews.Author: julien56
Reviews.Content: super view of hyde park, perfect service, large room and amazing bathroom

Reviews.Title: “We expected to be pampered but were disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Mypace
Reviews.Content: From a St Regis a casual response is unacceptable. Even Geoffrey Gelardi, the Managing Director agrees. My wife and I wanted to be pampered at The Lanesborough again, so we booked a room for a week - July 6 to 13. On the second day a request to make a couple of restaurant bookings was dealt by the concierge so casually that it left me in disgust. I managed to call the restaurant myself and get confirmation. I went to the desk and mentioned that they needn't bother with my requests as I had got the confirmations. Not a word of query or apology. My feedback on the customer survey form at departure, received prompt attention and the right noises from the MD himself. He asked me for a name of the concierge attendant but one does note down names in anticipation of writing a complaint. The desk maintains a register of such requests so they should be able to find the delinquency if, as the MD said the attitude was unacceptable. Everyone else was great, particularly the butler was a gem of a guy. But alas, the unpleasant behaviour of the Concierge, stuck so hard that looking back, I regret that we did not once indulge in the afternoon high tea that we normally have taken even when we have stayed elsewhere, nor allowed their spa to pamper us or booked a table at Aspleys. Instead, we walked across to the Metropolitan (Como Shambala), to Theo Randall at the Intercontinental Hotel or even to the Wolseley for brunch on Sunday. This may have been our last stopover at The Lanesborough. We prefer the Metropolitan rooms overlooking the Green Park. Though their spa is very basic they have excellent therapists. An irritant that I did not record in the hotel survey, but looking at this questionnaire, I add for the benefit of your readers, water flooded out of our shower on to the floor. The morning and evening turn down service took care of it but I would have thought the engineering department should have been notified by the maids. The room was a good size one, well furnished, very cosy with a private library. The view from the windows on the second floor was not the greatest. We did not miss the fridge or the iron as the butler was just a call away, but I am sure if asked, most travellers would prefer these in the room. The Lanesborough has competition even down Knightsbridge, so it is important they retain their loyal customers. I hope our recent experience was an aberration and not a slip that will show again.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea was absolutely brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: jamiek1012
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went for afternoon tea at the Lanesborough yesterday and it was delightful. I highly reccommend this place for anyone looking to have a great, posh afternoon tea. The service was perfect. We hardly drained our cups before they were refilled. And, they boxed up some scones for us to take home (at our request - so ask!). I had read that they will happily let you sample more than one tea when they bring you a fresh pot. With that in mind, I'd intended to sample several, but the tea I started with, Rose Gougeon(sp?), was so good that I didn't want to change. Everything was delicious - sandwiches, tea cakes, pastries, scones. If I have any regret about this tea, it's that I don't have 2 stomachs because I would have happily eaten twice as much as I was able to! We skipped lunch so our appetites would be ready and were very happy that we did. This tea is not cheap. We paid about Â£100 for 2 people to have the Belgravia Tea (comes with champagne and strawberries and cream). But, I would go back in a heartbeat...every day if I could afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: skiwestus
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we knew it would be exceptional. Private greeting, butler service, called us by name, etc. Recommend you have the butler unpack and pack for you.....learned some great packing tips when we got home and had to unpack by ourselves!! Special gifts everyday, including a personalized birthday cake!!! Definitely will return!

Reviews.Title: “A real flop”
Reviews.Author: Sariano
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to write this comment, but after spending a wonderful time at Hotel 41 last week (#2 in Tripadvisor for London), I decided to do justice to good and bad hotels in that city. The Lanesborough is bad hotel in a very impressive building. The front desk and concierge people are cold and arrogant. They failed to inform in advance that this is one of the only Starwood properties that does not participate of the Rewards Program. They failed to mention that my room was going to be in a floor that looked like a construction site, with dust everywhere. They messed up my (expensive) car reservation. No wonder does not even get to be in the top 200 hotels in Tripadvisor. Such a pitty... a property with so much potential so badly managed.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional wedding reception and stay.”
Reviews.Author: MorganM_11
Reviews.Content: Ten of us stayed at the Lanesborough in April for our daughter's wedding (Morgan- Ellis)and the reception was also held in the function rooms downstairs. We would like to thank all the staff who made it so special - every detail was taken care of so perfectly and in such a professional manner. We all had a marvellous stay and would like to thank all concerned. Everything ran smoothly, our guests were given a very warm welcome and staff were superb. If you are looking to find a venue for a wedding, look no further than here. Thanks to all - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very faded glory”
Reviews.Author: champagnetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Landesborough has all the edifices of what it ONCE was a charming beautiful hotel. Now, the lights, bath tub stop, jacuzzi, TV remote control, do not work, rugs faded, and housekeeping absent mindedness forgets you exists. Food is neither here nor there, order the same meal is is different each time. No, I won't be back after 5 years in a row. Time to find a new home when in London. Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive service”
Reviews.Author: MarakiOttawa
Reviews.Content: Went to London for a special trip and decided to stay at St. Regis as I am a fan of the chain. However, when we arrived the room wasn't ready, and then there were issues with the room and finally the door lock was broken. Not impressed as our trip wasn't starting on the right foot - HOWEVER - they moved us into another beautiful suite to make up for the delay and were very apologetic. Our butler was amazing, as was all the staff. We were so impressed about how attentive they were to ensure that we were completely satisfied. The location is excellent as everything is nearby and I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: worldtrav1990
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that Mr. Gelardi (GM) runs a top notch place and with Managers' like Michael at the front desk along with his co-workers, it only adds to the pleasure of feeling like you are the ONLY Guest. I have stayed at many hotels worldwide and continue to be impressed with places like the Lanesborough in London. You walk in and somehow you seem to have the place to yourself although it might be completely full of Guests. We arrived early around 10 a.m. and was greeted by Michael who immediately handed us the keys and his co-worker ( the lady that showed us to the room) was kind and very polite which is how it should be. Yes, you pay very good money but that in itself should tell people that the expectations are much higher. You step out of the hotel with the Hyde Park and the bustle of London at your steps. The service at Breakfast and throughout the hotel EXCELLENT. I have eaten at the best of places and these guys have it down for perfection. The Housekeeping/Front Door and Bellman...you guys deserve great tips and more. I Loved it and will be back often and look forward to sending my family there soon as well. Please understand everyone that I do have high expectations and if there are some issues, I expect them to resolve them so don't think I am a easy Guest. However, Mr. Gelardi obviously knows who to bring in and hire. I found a place that matches Four Seasons George V in Paris in service if not better. The Staff did not come off with an attitude and if they did..many of us would not come back. I am always amazed to see places/people with attitude...the only thing that separates us from others in staying at places like this place is our willingness to pay the price so I enjoy it when there is not the attitude. Class cannot be bought. I think Julia Child made the best comment of all in places of eating....IF they have to push their attitude on the patrons...walk out since the food can be bought at 50% less price elsewhere without the attitude. The Staff in the Aspley Rest. for dinner was excellent. I am having a challenge with the choice of menu they chose,however, the staff was top notch..review the menu prior to reservations. I have eaten at many 3*,2* and no star places and rarely do I see much difference in the food other than the service and presentation. I learned this from reading many Julia Child's comments. For Breakfast, you guys were perfect. Thank you employees of Lanesborough....all of you were great. Regarding Butler services...make sure there is a complete understanding of what is complimentary versus a paid service. I am sincere in my points here as I pay top dollar for my stays. Now, if we can convince Mr. Gelardi to take over the St Regis in San Francisco and Rome...I could be one happy Guest.

Reviews.Title: “Old meets new”
Reviews.Author: dmack68
Reviews.Content: First time I have stayed at The Lanesborough but had heard a lot of good things about the old charm of the place etc and they lived up to all those expectations of what i expected from this traditional hotel, great personal service, impeccably presented. However the surprising and best experience I had was the in room modern technology, a supplied laptop, but most of all the TV system was great, being able to record TV shows while I am out at meetings and then watch them at my convenience when i get back in the hotel. Brillant! Very personal service.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed at in London”
Reviews.Author: MarlonColey
Reviews.Content: The Lanesborough is an exceptionally good hotel. The whole experience from start to finish was phenomenal. Check in was smooth and faultless. Common areas were charming and warm. Rooms were nicely styled and decorated. Bathrooms were very nice with some charming extras that you dont see everywhere. Butler service was great and extremely willing and helpful. Service was perfect. All interactions with the concierge were great. They were very helpful with directions, advice, taxis and making reservations for restaurants, nightclubs etc. A very attentive and helpful lot which will enhance your stay given you require and help or advice. As a group of early to mid 20's travelers with smart-casual dress style (which I would say isnt typically the norm at this hotel), we were treated impeccably well (which isnt always the case with a group of foreign young men staying at a posh hotel). You get a very good atmosphere at the Lanesborough and will certainly enjoy your stay there. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have a great experience in London.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: NShubin
Reviews.Content: The Lanesborough exceeded even our high expectations for it. The rooms (we stayed in two different ones) were a mix of comfort, quiet and modern amenity. The service was impeccable and entirely accommodating. We travelled with two small kids and were pleased to find the degree to which the hotel made the visit pleasant for them and for us (they left small robes and slippers in the rooms for the kids, and were gracious with them in all public spaces). The staff makes the place special: it is very clear they take pride in the place and in providing guests a top notch experience. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “An almost faultless stay.”
Reviews.Author: DaveW62
Reviews.Content: An example of how first class hotel staff should be, with the level of service almost beyond reproach, without being intrusive. Room had all of expected facilities for both leasure and business purposes, including complimentary laptop. Although we were surprised not to find a fridge, which the butler instantly made available, and our suite was a little on the small size without any view. The Garden Room with its superb cigar selection is a bonus and the ambience of both that and the Library Bar are worthy of a visit, even if you don't stay at the hotel - plenty of non-resident customers to chat with.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh to the point of almost feeling uncomfortable.”
Reviews.Author: KellyRebecca22
Reviews.Content: my partner and i are not from a wealthy background but saved and went to this hotel as a treat. the hotel was nice, clean, old fashioned but in a nice way, staff where on hand, butlers to the ready however we didnt wish to use them as i found it a little to strange! the food we ordered from room service was excellent and the room/bathroom was very nice all old antique furniture and a full marble bathroom. i would say this was a good hotel for people that are used to that standard of living however we just didnt fit in and the other guests staying there made us fully aware by the way they looked at us.

Reviews.Title: “A big let down!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovingsunshine
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay at this hotel since it is ranked as one of the nicest and most expensive in London. I am sorry to say but it was a big let down. The location is amazing but the service levels were very poor. It took 15 minutes for someone to take my order at breakfast one morning. The Italian staff doesn't speak proper English and just doesn't make you feel very well taken care of. My food had something strange in it and all they did was apologize briefly. Next breakfast I ordered room service, and got a different kind of juice from what I asked. I was just told that this one was also freshly squeezed, this was again from a gentleman with a different strong accent and not very kind about my comment on why a different kind of juice. TV never worked properly. Staff at front door would open the door for you most of the time but they just kept on carrying their conversation and didn't bother too much to acknowledge and greet you. Let alone remember your name. When I asked about shows in London the person at the concierge gave me a pamphlet and asked what I was looking for. I said I would like to see a modern dance show and he went on to tell me about musicals. Obviously he was either not knowledgeable about the type of show I wanted to see or just didn't pay attention to what I said. I found the staff in general to be not pleasant for this class of a hotel. I have stayed in other St. Regis hotels before and in general they have all exceeded my expectations. However, this hotel ranks very low in my books and I will probably never come back. There are so many other options in London in the surrounding area for the same or much better price.

Reviews.Title: “What happened? A must see becomes a must miss.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler7768
Reviews.Content: I just checked into the Lanesborough and checked out 90 minutes later. They stuck me in a tiny fourth floor room that had dings and cracks in the moldings and doors and chipped paint everywhere. When I called downstairs to request a different room, they offered me a "larger" room down the hall. They must think their guests are not intelligent as the new room was the same room size as the other. Nonetheless, I kept the first room until the television system failed to work. I then moved to the "larger" room which was just as beat up as the first one. I promptly left that room when its television also failed to work. They then moved me to a tiny room on the first floor as its television worked. As my bag and I could not fit in this new room at the same time, I promptly went to the front desk and checked out. I am now in a beautiful suite at the Berkeley. What happened to the Lanesborough? It used to my favorite. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: OrangeGoblin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hotels all over the world and this was one of the best. When we arrived we had our room upgraded to a Suite, so things got off to a good start. The staff were amazing, except one of the bar waiters, who was a little too familiar for my liking, but never the less it was a perfect stay. Whenver we called we were answered promptly, the suite was amazing, the food superb and the location ideal for visiting London...We had our own butler and a laptop provided for our use. We had business cards and stationary printed when we arrived. I will certainly stay there again as soon as i can.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed in Lanesborough. Value for money it is not.”
Reviews.Author: nicholas2121
Reviews.Content: I have probably stayed in every 5* hotel in London over the years and I must say that I was particularily dissapointed with the Lanesborough. My basic metric for hotels is value for money. I have no issue paying a very high price with the one basic rule that I feel as though I have gotten good value. I have paid thousands of dollars for a hotel room and been very content with the service and I have paid $50 for a room and been happy. I booked an "Executive" room at the Lanesborough which was a few categories above the basic level room. I have seen small rooms in my life and this was perhaps the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. It would have been difficult enough for one person to fit in the room, having my girlfriend with me made it almost impossible. We literally could not both fit in the main room at the same time. I am not complaining about the size of the room, I am complaining that it was sold as an "Executive" room and that I was charged over 600GBP for it. I very rarely do this, but the size of the room became so confining that I had to check out and move to the connaught which offered a room quadruple the size, for half the price. There is no problem with renting a room of that size, however The Lanesborough needs to knock it down to their lowest room category and put the square footage (my guess would be no more than 130) on their website so customers who require a normal amount of space are able to make other plans. First and last time staying at this hotel unfortunatley.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea”
Reviews.Author: Jools100
Reviews.Content: As I live and work in London I have dined at many of our fine establishments and have experienced afternoon tea at The Lanesborough before. This time I took 3 friends who had never been before, all was going well and to the usual fine standards (albeit the teas were mixed up, think I sampled 3) Then we paid the bill by cash and credit card. My friends card was taken away from the table for a good 10/15 minutes with no explanation, I had to request change which apparently had to be sourced from reception. I don't think the staff can cope with cash and credit card, so much so we were given too much change! I doubt I will return in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Never will I stay somewhere else in London again”
Reviews.Author: Juleskum
Reviews.Content: As a Lanesborough first-timer I was downright impressed. The very large upgrade that we received without charge on arrival no doubt contributed to this feeling of complete satisfaction with the hotel, but even without that I would still go back again and again. Lanesborough is luxurious yet friendly, elegant yet welcoming, the staff is just ...nice and the facilities are perfect. You will no doubt find hipper hotels, but personally I love it when tradition and history is in every detail. I've stayed at many five star hotels, Claridge's included, and none come close. You'd expect from a hotel this pricy that location, service + facilities meet high expectations, and Lanesborough definately pass. But more importantly, it has this non-describable factor that just makes it special.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: GlamourHoliday
Reviews.Content: Wow I was very impressed whilst staying at this wonderful hotel! Everything was 5* luxury. Yes it is pricey but what do you expect for a hotel of this standard?? It was a very classy hotel and perfect for me and my husbands needs! We loved going to the garden bar for a cigar, it's nice to see a 5* hotel offer a smoking area, this just added to the enjoyment we had. Thank you for offering the smoking room too! Will certinatly come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless every way”
Reviews.Author: thesnowflake
Reviews.Content: Great service (attention to every detail), perfect in-room breakfast, state of the art spacious suite. Very highly recommended. Reasonable rates (comparing to other hotels of the same quality). Good location. Perfect for romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea”
Reviews.Author: isswhizz
Reviews.Content: We had afternoon tea at the hotel a week ago and it was a fantastic experience. The service was excellent but formal but friendly. We arrived early and we were shown through to the library to sit and wait. We were then shown through to the restaurant where we treated like kings! I thought Â£35 seemed a lot for afternoon tea but I would have paid twice that for the service we received. The food was delicious...smoked salmon sandwiches on beetroot bread, egg mayonaisse brioche rolls, little chicken sandwiches, cheese sanwiches, tiny carrot cakes with icing, lovely delicate gateaux, trifle shots, toasted teacakes with cinnamon butter and scones with jam, clotted cream and homemade lemon curd. I will definately be back...maybe one day I will be able to afford to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old world luxury. First Class!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFam3
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of my favorite hotels. The location is superb and the rooms are beautiful. It really has this old world charm. Because the hotel is on the smaller side the staff is very attentive and throughout our stay remembered each of our names and preferences. We were welcomed in the morning with tea prepared just how I enjoy it and when it was raining outside they game me an umbrella to take with me on my trip. The lounge in the lobby was great for a cocktail during the cold weather and the bartender took excellent care of us. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Blame it on Mr. French and "Family Affair": I've always wanted a butler!”
Reviews.Author: sdtravelgirlSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I spent two fabulous nights at this hotel last December. Upon entering, I was greeted by a staff member who apologized profusely for failing to have the room prepared by 10:00 am, per my request. Come again? The hotel was granting me the favor. After briefly sitting in a beautiful drawing room replete with oil paintings, leather chairs, and wait staff donning traditional black outfits with white ruffled aprons, pouring tea and coffee in beautiful china, I met my â€œbutlerâ€�. He escorted me to my luxurious, room. I realized the hotel had provided an upgraded room immediately upon entering. My room, which overlooked Hyde Park, boasted a beautiful canopy bed, a sitting area sporting a with a leather couch, mahogany furniture, oil paintings, office desk, a complimentary lap top, and two television sets, one which popped out of a stunning armoire at the click of a button. I was also provided a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates. In spite of its exclusive, private English club feel and the presence of some obviously over-the-top filthy rich guests, this hotel is welcoming to all. Youâ€™re paying the bill after all; donâ€™t feel out of place. Iâ€™ve had tea at the Lanesborough on a few occasions prior to my stay, and the staff is inconsistently warm, courteous and professional. Unlike the Dorchester, which is a bit of a walk to the nearest tube, The Lanesborough is literally steps away from the Knightsbridge tube, making it a dream location during the sporadically heavy December rains. Although vastly different in style and environment (see my Dorchester review), the Lanesborough and the Dorchester are equally luxurious and amazing. I love both of these hotels. Overall, the Lanesborough provides the ultimate hotel experience. Check their Starwood website for special offers. I would return in a heartbeat to this historic hotel, unsurpassed in luxury, customer service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned luxury in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: MicheleSomerset
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our three teenage children to celebrate my eldest son's 18th birthday. Staff were wonderfully helpful, butler even arranged a birthday cake and card for my son as a surprise free of charge. Rooms were lovely & spacious and bathrooms excellent. Breakfast and dinner were both exceptionally good. It is expensive obviously but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: AAG22
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at most of the 5-star properties in London, I cannot say I would choose the Lanesborough again. Deciding to take a last minute trip, AmEx was able to secure a room here. The majority of the staff was excellent, however the woman who checked me in was not. She told me there would be a wait of 1.5 hour for a room and I decided to wait in the library, as it was early and nothing was open. After two hours, I had still heard nothing and went to check, a different woman said another 10 mins. Fine, but the woman who originally checked me should have at least updated me, instead of just leaving me sitting there, at least that is what I expect from a 5 star hotel. My room was very small and was a smoking room, which I didn't at first notice, until the air/fan came on. My reservation was for a non-smoking room, but I had already unpacked and didn't feel like dealing with it. The bathroom had a strong smell of urine. The internet was spotty. I had a massage which was wonderful, however I was on the 4th floor, and the back elevator (closer to the spa) does not have access to the 4th floor, so I ended up coming out of the main elevator in a bath robe to get to and from the spa, passing people going to the bar. The location is great, right across from the park and close to shopping. The doormen are all very friendly and helpful. It is a nice hotel, however I would probably only stay here again if my other London favorites are not available.

Reviews.Title: “carpet in restauarant filthy downstairs hallways smells like vomit”
Reviews.Author: golfbob
Reviews.Content: need i say more. I like Claridges better. Although service is good and location is good the hotel seems neglected

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea at the Lanesborough”
Reviews.Author: rupz112
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat my wife to afternoon tea to celebrate her birthday. In all honesty, due to its reputation, at first I attempted to book tea at Claridges however was told that they had a three month waiting list for weekend bookings. A friend recommended the Lanesborough, and I am so glad went. The hotel is ideally located by Hyde Park corner tube and was very easy to get to. From the moment we walked into the hotel, we were greeted very warmly by the staff, and when we entered the tea room were welcomed to the sound of a piano being played by a very talented musician. We were offered advice on our selection of tea which I found very helpful, and then out came the sandwiches and cakes. I forgot the inform the hotel that I was vegetarian upon booking, but this wasnâ€™t a problem - the waiter actually apologised to me that he didnâ€™t know, and brought out a plate of fresh sandwiches - excellent service. The amount of food that was bought out, and how amazingly presented it was could not be faulted in anyway. Every time my tea became half full, my waiter would topup my tea for me. They were very attentive, very well spoken and thoroughly charming. We were quite full by the time the scones and tea cakes came out, but like the rest of the food, they were delicious. My only advice to anyone else going is to make sure you save some room for them because they were probably the best scones I have ever had. My only gripe of the event was when I phoned to make a booking, I was told to dress relatively smart - no trainers/jeans etc. Most of the people who were there obeyed this rule, however they were a small group who didnâ€™t - it would have been nice if everyone paid attention to the dress code. All in all, a wonderful experience which I would highly recommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best In London.”
Reviews.Author: Alain-london72
Reviews.Content: Yes after having stayed at much of the luxury Hotels in London, I can say the Lanesborough is superior in most departments. Service is usually flawless, Rooms are very clean,comfortable,nice features,One of the only hotels with a Butler services. Bathroom amenties are very good. Staff are quite attentive for the moment you walk in. The Food is just above average but the Afternoon tea is the best one in London. I think the room service could be improved as well. The fitness gym is very small for this caliber of hotel and should be improved. The cigar bar in the Lower level should prioritize hotel guest even if the Bar is very popular with external guest and Bar staff could be friendlier. During my last stay there was a leak in the hotel and the looby had a foul smell during most of our stay, I think the hotel could have offered guest and certainly reuturning guest some incentives. A good hotel that could be an amazing hotel, stayed there many times and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Staff need to speaking with”
Reviews.Author: Spaghettilegs
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have been to the Lanesborough and the experience was so bad that it is doubtful that we will return. We were sat in the library bar prior to leaving when another customer for some unknown reason took an intense dislike to my wife and I for the simply innocuous act of sitting down and ordering a drink . She told the floor manager on duty (PM of 9 July 2010) that the standards in the place where slipping and then tried to have them call security to have us removed . This was astounding behaviour on her behalf as we were neither loud nor offensive. The floor manager looked as us, shrugged his shoulders and walked off. Thankfully (mainly for the other guests in the bar) the security never appeared otherwise there would have been an almighty row. The rude guest, however, is not the issue. The issue is that there was no apology offered to us for the differential treatment we received. I don't expect at a hotel of the supposed standard of the Lanesborough to be harangued by fellow guests and then have the staff not acknowledge the situation . Very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: Bigtravel
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel twice already; but decieded to take a friend for afternoon tea as a birthday treat and thought it warrented a review. Had a four thirty booking; arrived and promptly shown to our seats. The restaurant has recently been refurbished and redone as apselys. Altough the decor itself is lovely; I always prefered the conservatory and thougt that was a much lovlier setting. The tea was perfect and constantly topped up for us. We went through three plates of sandwhiches; and several helpings of pretty cakes and scones and tea cakes. I think the whole presentation of the afternoon tea was lovely and with a pianist in the background-definatley made a relaxing setting, I think the service was outstanding and the staff genuinaley seemed to enjoy working at the hotel-especially the waiter serving us (didn't catch his name). Do note that everyone does get asked to leave at six-Im assuming to get ready for the dinner crowd. Did have a quick peek at their garden bar-which is discreetly hidden. The bar was small but busy and from what I was told there was a Â£25 minimum spend..... after spending Â£80 for tea decided to give it a miss this time around and had a show to catch anyway. Is it worth it-personally I'd say yes and would probably no doubt return for tea

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Loacation, Top Service, Every Convenience”
Reviews.Author: BeachMax
Reviews.Content: The Rooms: Fully equiped with Sony Vaio laptop; Wifi; computer controlled lighting and temperature at bedside; jacuzzi tub; large safe; fireplace; 20" LCD TV; free movies and a butler for whatever else you think of... Service: Excellent Concierge, Butler, Restaurant Staff, Front Door - nothing missed Location: Hyde Park Corner - next to Park, Subway, Shopping, Restaurants. Food => Great restaurant - glass ceiling and good bar (Library Room). 5 Star Hotel with 5 Star prices to match.

Reviews.Title: “bit twee, bit smelly”
Reviews.Author: dubainick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights last month staying for 2 beautiful spring days with temperatures 25C+. First impression arriving in the early evening with temperatures still warm was that the fire in the lobby and the lounge was pretty wasteful - this carried on throughout the two days irrespective of the short sleeves being worn by 80% of the people outside. Sorry I am not overly green, but what a total waste of money. Second impression was at the lift and I thought it smelt as if somebody had vomited and the cleaners had not got rid of the smell - people coming to collect me also noticed it, with the smell lasting all my visit - so given the comment of another recent review describing it as cheesy smell - its not me! Room is OK - bit small for the price and getting a little bit worn. Also pretty low ceilings so a little claustrophobic. Bed a bit soft, but I had an OK sleep. Insulation fantastic - could not hear a thing. View - not sure if you could describe it as such - looked on to a small balcony with some plants, and you could peer through the ballustrades 1 metre from the window at the Gherkin building - so is that really a view? The twee taste is not for me, but I guess if you its your taste so be it. Agree with the comment on being a bit dark for work, but computer available is pretty good - and never seen that before. I was also not overly impressed by the attitude of the concierge - pretty surly. A la carte breakfast was reasonable - sausages were excellent. Reception girls were pleasant. Location is good - 10 metres from Hyde Park Corner tube. Would I stay there again for business - no. At the price, as a toursit, certainly not.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points, but felt service could be more attentive.”
Reviews.Author: jv7007
Reviews.Content: We did enjoy our stay at the hotel, but on reflection would not go back. The hotel did have some good points (location, good size room and spa treatments) but I felt for the price we paid that the staff just were not attentive enough and acted slightly superior. (not the doormen - who were great). Overall the service seemed to be an effort for some staff compared to other 5 star hotels that we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: candacegar
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to spend the night at The Lanesborough hotel before returning home from a lengthy trip to Italy. I wish we could have spent more time there. The hotel is absolutely beautiful! Our room was a delight and the staff were so friendly and helpful!!!!! The room even had a laptop for our use. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID at all costs! There are MUCH better alternatives”
Reviews.Author: belair100
Reviews.Content: Wow what a disappointment. I have stayed at most of the hotels in London so I thought I would give the Lanesborough Hotel a try. I flew in from Los Angeles and went straight to the hotel in a taxi. I had not had a chance to change any money to pounds yet so when the bellman asked to carry my bags I declined. I did not tip him for holding the door for me and he was not pleasant( I have read in other reviews that this is an issue). I was not sure what I should have tipped him for and I would have more than made up for it when I had pounds if he was pleasant. At the check in I inquired about a corporate rate as my company uses around 500 room nights in London ( about 75 just for myself) and I was curtly told that they do not honor any corporate rate. They must be doing quite well to turn down this offer of business. The second day of my stay I received a call from the "butler" to ask if I wanted my room cleaned. I was in the shower so I declined. A few minutes later I heard the chambermaid enter my room and I asked her to come back. We went out to dinner and upon return I received a very cold stare and he turned his back to me from Michael who was working the front area of the lobby. Tired of the poor treatment I called and asked for a manager. I filed my complaint and was told that I would receive a call back. I also noticed on Saturday eveing(April 10th) that a Mercedes Benz McLaren car that was parked out front was being driven by the door man with the door pointed to the sky. The door was bouncing on the hinges as he drove away. I would not be very happy if that was my car. This is easy to verify this action by watching the cctv cameras on April 10th. I would be very cautious to leave any car at the valet. On Sunday while I was sleeping the do not disturb sign was still on the door and another chamber maid came into the room so they do not respect your privacy!. If you plan on using your room for any type of business be warned that the lighting is not sufficient. Upon checkout I still had not heard back from anyone about my valid complaints and I was told that they do not call guests before noon as they could be sleeping. Keep in mind that 36 hours have passed at this point. The staff was never warm nor inviting. The lobby smells like strong cheese when you depart and enter the lift. The day manager called me an hour after I departed to say that he had received my complaints. At no point did it ever feel sincere or that they would do anything about my issues or address it with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Our Perfect Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Finn96
Reviews.Content: We wanted an intimate, elegant wedding at a classic London Hotel. We contacted a number of the hotels mentioned in the previous review to see if they could meet our requirement to create something special but "non-weddingy". None of them seemed able to step out of the "Off-the-peg" wedding box. We were unsure about trying The Lanesborough but thank heavens we did. Eva Dutton, the events manager worked with us from start to finish to create something truly memorable and lovely that went without a hitch. She listened, made suggestions and together with all the staff there made a day and overnight stay for us that was more beautiful, joyous and relaxing than we could even have hoped. The team at the hotel made us feel as if we were the most important bridal party ever to walk through their doors and that our wedding was as significant an event for them as it was for us. Food, drink, service, suite and special touches were all exceptional. This is a special place which seems to be filled with quite special staff. Thank you so much - we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: bubblybob
Reviews.Content: We had afternoon tea at the Lanesborough to celebrate my mothers 90th birthday. All the members of staff that we met were most attentive and made the afternoon very special. The food was delicious and beautifully presented and the singing of 'Happy Birthday' really made my mothers day. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want from a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovelondon2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of my 50th birthday week of celebrations, on arrival l was informed they had upgraded me to a suite which was fantastic and they even made me a birthday cake! From check in to check out you were made to feel special, from the coffee with those very moreish biscuits (would love to have the recipe for those!) to my english breakfast delivered to my room everything was first class. My 24 hr butler introduced himself and bought in champagne and chocolates, you could not ask more from a hotel. The staff were so lovely, especially the lady in the library bar... sorry l cannot remember her name, typical of me! Would definetely stay here again not just for a special celebration, anytime.... you won't regret booking this wonderul hotel.

Reviews.Title: “See through the embellished description!”
Reviews.Author: Airbus388
Reviews.Content: The Lanesborough is a hotel that doesn't respect regular customers. Honored guests in a private home?? Certainly not. Cared for by 'personal' butlers?? Well yes, if your definition of personal is multiple and you enjoy repeating yourself. Certainly, some parts of the hotel live upto expectations, like the bars and restaurant, but this is just a small part of the entire experience and cannot make up for the disrespectful treatment from quite a few members of the Managment Staff. Also, the Afternoon Tea is not only horrendously expensive but also of a very poor standard. I shall not be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Lanesborough - Go to Browns”
Reviews.Author: Nesspresso
Reviews.Content: A total rip off comes to mind! At an extortionate Â£108 for afternoon tea for two, this entitled you to a spartan array of ornately decorated mini cakes and pastries that frankly did not entice your tastebuds, 6 or so dull sandwiches ( no cucumber sandwiches in sight), one small slice of xmas cake and the greatest of injustices - two minuscule dry scones with clotted cream. I would have thought that the plates would have been constantly replenished but we clearly had to ask for more sandwiches (which we were told we could have once we had finished our plate of unappealing leftovers - like naughty children). As far as location is concerned, the Lanesborough is a stunningly beautiful old world venue (I guess you are paying for that!). The service was of a high standard however I always find it a little unnnerving when staff are unnaturally conscious of trying not to make a mistake. I am astounded that this hotel received a Tea Guild award in 2008. All in all, I was so looking forward to my Lanesborough afternoon tea experience but left feeling greatly disappointed and hungry!! After hearing fantastic reports of endless plates at afternoon tea at Browns hotel, this hotel fails miserably!

Reviews.Title: “The Lanesborough is even more than they claim”
Reviews.Author: SkiGirlColorado
Reviews.Content: Seriously, the Lanesborough is worth every penny (pence?) and then some. From arrival to departure, I have never enjoyed staying in a hotel more. The doormen were lovely, so personable! the front office staff, the guys in library bar, everyone warm and truly give the word hospitaltiy meaning. My 21 year old daughter stayed with me, and I have dragged her all over the world with me -- the Lanesborough is now her favorit (probably because she called our butler Tony at 3 am and he got her pickles and chocolates). Our room was fabulous, very clean and well stocked. the only negative (why must there always be something?) the flat screen in the armoire was so small it could not be seen from the bed -- and so far away from the bed the remote control wouldn't work very well. The room service was spectacular, from the superb coffee in the morning to the smoked salmon salad. One night when we were homesick Tony rustled us up some quesadillas. If you can find a better location, book it. We got right off the underground and were there -- stroll down to Harrod's, tea over at Buckingham Palace (well not exactly but we could have!) Oh, also I discovered I left my power cord to my computer at home, and had a presenation the next day. Of course Tony turned up with one! Pay it -- book it -- it's worth it. Love Lanesborough. Love Tony our butler, you are so funny!

Reviews.Title: “A Tradition of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: mcog
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Lanesborough and look forward to returning. Not only are the accommodations comfortably elegant but the entire staff make you feel as if their sole purpose in life is to provide for your every need. Apsleys restaurant was the best we enjoyed in London during the week we stayed. The staff in the Library Bar could not have been more welcoming and attentive. Luxuriously wonderful! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Afternoon Tea”
Reviews.Author: liverpoolCheshire
Reviews.Content: My Son and Daughter, paid for me and 2 friends, to have afternoon tea on 26th September, for my birhday. We where all looking forward to our weekend in London, especially our visit to the Lanesborough. Our arrival was fine. Decor very nice. Our reservation was 4.30. We enjoyed our strawberrys. Sandwiches and pastries arrived. We had not started on our pastries, when about 5.30/5.45pm we where told they would have to serve our scones, and tea cakes. AS they had to clear up for dinner. The waiter said you can go in the bar, which we did. nobody showed us to the bar, or carried our champagne in for us.Being RUSHED really spoilt our experience of the Lanesborough.

Reviews.Title: “All good but if you like classy don't go to the Library Bar...”
Reviews.Author: Supermara
Reviews.Content: ... unless you don't mind staff with a lack of respect and proffessionalism, rude and loud. Poor service. The location only doesn't justify the high prices unless it comes with an impecable service. It's more like a countryside tavern than an stylish hotel. The Hotel itself is fantastic, promt and friendly service everywhere but Library. Beautiful rooms and full of nice tasteless details. The Spa room. oh well, they were using a faulty massage table on clients... what can I say?....

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea at the Lanesborough: Our top tip for a day in London”
Reviews.Author: Thrift_Junky
Reviews.Content: The ultimate treat! Greeted by impeccably dressed doormen, waited on by extremely attentive yet unobtrusive waiters and soothed by the gently tinkling of romantic but cheeky improvised live piano music. The conservatory tearoom is bright and refreshingly decorated with a clever blend of traditional and ultra-contemporary, reflected in everything from the furnishings to the wall art. A wide selection of teas are well described on the menu, including some very rare ones (at Â£2 extra) of which only a few kilograms are made each year! The cakes and pastries were little miniature works of art: the attention to detail made it almost a crime to eat them....but absolutely delicious as well. Overall, Tea at the Lanesborough is our top tip for anyone who asks what they should do when visiting London. Take a good couple of hours: sip tea and eat slowly (you get a lot of food: sandwiches, cakes, pastries, teacakes and scones with cream, jam and lemon curd!) and see how the other half live for the afternoon. We also used the bar and the library room which were pleasant rooms where we enjoyed a cocktail and complimentary olives/nuts/nibbles which were only slightly spoiled by some arrogant guests who didn't know how to behave in such an elogant setting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: fickleWestMids
Reviews.Content: The Lanesborough was recommended to us for an overnight stay in London and it did not disappoint. Great location to start with and first impressions of the reception etc, were very good. We were briefly shown round and then to our room by a very attentive chap. The staff in general were all a credit to the place. Our room was lovely and very spacious. The bathroom was a nice size too and the bath was very luxurious. One gripe here however- there were lots of pretty wrapped bars of soap dotted about the place, but why no showergel? It seems odd. Afternoon Tea was lovely as expected. The one thing I would change is to stop the staff constantly topping up your cup of tea. I understand they want to be attentive but it's not as simple as topping up a water glass with more water. You have a cup of tea, get the amount of milk and sugar right, drink half of it and then someone pours in more tea , diluting the drink you have, thus requiring you to add more milk, sugar, etc. Why not let people enjoy one cup of tea at a time? The Library bar is definitly worth visiting. I had a very agreeable nightcap in there. The bar staff were all very friendly and worked the room well. Serving drinks efficiently but chatting to customers at the same time. Breakfast the next morning was also excellent and rounded off a great weekend. It was marred only slightly by the sight of what appeared to be a dead bird caught in the netting above the glass roof and flapping merrily in the breeze. I wonder if anyone else has noticed it and whether it has been removed yet? All in all, a lovely experience and one we are sure to repeat. I would definitely recommend The Lanesbourgh.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime, sumptuous”
Reviews.Author: benitomussolini
Reviews.Content: This is the finest establishment in the world. This hotel oozes character, it reminds me of my old Knightsbridge apartment. I now spend my time between Paris and Bora Bora. I can assure you that there are very few hotels that deliver such a high level of comfort. The manager here is a genius. His care for customers is reflected in the attention to creating a unique response to every review on this website. My butler was perfect. I have long believed that the quality of a hotel is also dependent upon the quality of the guests, indeed there were no unsavoury types staying in this gem of a hotel. I prefer this by far to the 'Hotel Crillon' in Paris. I will be returning soon for another slice of home. Many thanks to the great men and women who made my holiday so thoroughly unique.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Trvlstrp
Reviews.Content: The Lanesborough is probably the nicest hotel in which I have stayed in quite some time. I travel extensively and stay in very deluxe properties and this one is tops. My husband and I, along with another couple had the pleasure of staying here for just one night before we boarded a SilverSea cruise. The service was impeccable. Our room was not quite ready when we arrived and they seated us in the bar and treated us to tea. When the room was ready our Butler escorted us to it and explained the many amenities, (pop up flat panel TVs, pressing service, personal business cards) very impressive. A computer was provided at no cost for our personal use during our stay. No trying to figure out how to get online! A chilled bottle of champagne was waiting for us also. The bed was to die for...and the linens were sumptous. (I am a big linens snob!) If you are going to be in London you must stay here...it is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: afficionado92
